item.title: ADHD
item.description: ADHD Concept Description Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder Sometimes referred to as ADD if there isn’t a hyperactivity component. Related To [[Neurodiversity]] Sourced From

item.title: Advice for Aspiring Managers
item.description: Advice for Aspiring Managers Concept Description [[Kelly Schroeder]] observes that aspiring managers should know what their personal leadership style looks like.

item.title: After You Get In
item.description: After You Get In Concept Description Many people spend a lot of time strategizing and executing on getting their dream job, but not about what to do after getting that job.

item.title: Apprentice, Journeyman, Master
item.description: Apprentice, Journeyman, Master Concept Description Historical use Historical progression from unskilled laborer to professional to master, as practiced in guilds of artisans.

item.title: Building a Brand
item.description: Building a Brand Concept Description [[Brad Pinkston]] notes that part of the process of getting promoted to management (or possibly just promoted in general) is a brand building exercise.

item.title: Career Advice
item.description: Career Advice Concept Description [[Placeholder]] Related To Sourced From

item.title: Career Experiences Shape Career Desires
item.description: Career Experiences Shape Career Desires Concept Description Going through experiences we do and don’t like in our careers helps us to define what we want and don’t want in our dream workplace.

item.title: Career Goals
item.description: Career Goals Concept Description [[Placeholder]] Related To [[Career Planning]] Sourced From

item.title: Characteristics of Good Managers
item.description: Characteristics of Good Managers Concept Description [[Kelly Schroeder]] mentioned that a manager he replaced very clearly cared about the wellbeing of the team and it’s memebers, both personally and professionally.

item.title: Coaching vs. Directing
item.description: Coaching vs. Directing Concept Description [[Placeholder]] Related To Sourced From

item.title: Committing to Career Advancement
item.description: Committing to Career Advancement Concept Description Career advancement may happen accidentaly, but it makes more sense to commit oneself to putting focus on the subject.

item.title: Community Participation for Career Advancement
item.description: Community Participation for Career Advancement Concept Description [[Tony Reeves]] discussed advancement and opportunities that he received by participating in technology communities, specifically the advocacy programs.

item.title: Compensation
item.description: Compensation Concept Description [[Placeholder]] Related To Sourced From

item.title: COVID-19
item.description: COVID-19 Concept Description Coronavirus Disease 19, a pandemic that spread from China to the rest of the world starting in 2019.

item.title: Deep Practice
item.description: Deep Practice Concept Description The Three Rules of Deep Practice Break concepts into chunks Absorb the whole thing Break it into chunks Slow down Practice every day Learn to feel when you are in deep practice mode

item.title: Deliberate Practice
item.description: Deliberate Practice Concept Description [[Placeholder]] Related To [[Deep Practice]] Sourced From [[Peak]] by [[Anders Ericsson]]

item.title: Developer Advocacy
item.description: Developer Advocacy Concept Description A type of work responsibility that entails acting as a two way communication point between developers using a company’s software products and the company’s product management, engineering, and executive teams.

item.title: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
item.description: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Concept Description [[Placeholder]] Related To Sourced From

item.title: Excellence vs Advancement
item.description: Excellence vs Advancement Concept Description [[Dom Delfinao]] mentioned on the Geek Whisperers that one key part of career advancement is to “Be great right now.

item.title: Giving Back
item.description: Giving Back Concept Description [[Placeholder]] Related To Sourced From

item.title: Great Resignation
item.description: Great Resignation Concept Description Period of time during the Covid19 Pandemic when people quit their jobs en mass. As the economy slowed down, people realized that some work environment weren’t worth dealing with.

item.title: Management Interviews
item.description: Management Interviews Concept Description [[Brad Pinkston]] spoke to the parallel between preparing for a management interview and preparing to take a certification exam.

item.title: Management vs. Leadership
item.description: Management vs. Leadership Concept Description [[Brad Pinkston]] says, “You don’t have to be a manager to be a leader.” Leadership is inspiring, teaching, mentoring, coaching, and supporting your colleagues.

item.title: Managing People is a Different Skill Set Than Being an Individual Contributor
item.description: Managing People is a Different Skill Set Than Being an Individual Contributor Concept Description [[Ethan Banks]] thought getting into managment would be like a technical lead, but found out it was resource management and coordination meetings.

item.title: Mentorship
item.description: Mentorship Concept Description [[Placeholder]] Related To Sourced From

item.title: Options for Career Advancement
item.description: Options for Career Advancement Concept Description One aspect of career advancement is knowing the possible types of roles you can advance toward.

item.title: Parental Leave
item.description: Parental Leave Concept Description An employee benefit which grants the employee leave for the purpose of birthing a child (and recovering from the birthing process), supporting a partner birthing a child, or adopting and bonding with a child.

item.title: Paths to Management
item.description: Paths to Management Concept Description [[Kelly Schroeder]] described the coincidnece of his technology degree being embedded in a school of business, so having to take business related clasess like Accounting, Marketing, etc.

item.title: Peter Principle
item.description: Peter Principle Concept Description People tend to rise to the level where they are no longer competent. This is because people who are good at their jobs are promoted.

item.title: Pioneer, Settler, Town Planner
item.description: Pioneer, Settler, Town Planner Concept Description A model for propensity toward specific areas of technology. Pioneers are in the wilderness, blazing trails and making discoveries.

item.title: Pre-COVID
item.description: Pre-COVID Concept Description Referring (sometimes nostagically, sometimes referencing naivitee) the time before the world recognized [[COVID-19]] as a pandemic threat to health and the world economy.

item.title: Proof of Work
item.description: Proof of Work Concept Description As a part of career advancement, have some of your work product available for the public to view.

item.title: Quiet Quitting
item.description: Quiet Quitting Concept Description [[Placeholder]] Doing one’s job and rejecting work culture that implies that one should do extra, unpaid labor in the name of “getting ahead.

item.title: Ramp Time
item.description: Ramp Time Concept Description The amount of time it takes to be competent and comfortable with a skill or as a part of an organization.

item.title: Sales Engineering
item.description: Sales Engineering Concept Description [[Placeholder]] Related To Sourced From

item.title: Sales Quota
item.description: Sales Quota Concept Description Sales target for an individual or group with variable compensation of some ratio attached to the attainment of the quota.

item.title: Selling Yourself as a Product
item.description: Selling Yourself as a Product Concept Description Having a career is repeatedly selling yourself and your package of skills as a product to others.

item.title: Stillbirth
item.description: Stillbirth Concept Description [[Placeholder]] Related To Sourced From

item.title: Technical Prowess Doesn't Trump Emotional Intelligence
item.description: Technical Prowess Doesn’t Trump Emotional Intelligence Concept Description [[Ethan Banks]] mentions that he had to learn the hard way that technical prowess wasn’t the be-all, end-all.

item.title: The Craftsman Approach to Tool Selection
item.description: The Craftsman Approach to Tool Selection Concept Description Identify the core factors that determine success and happiness in your professional and personal life.

item.title: Unplugging from Work
item.description: Unplugging from Work Concept Description Removing the ability for casual connection to and from one’s work. This might be as simple as turning off notifications so as not to be interrupted, or as severe as removing email and messaging apps while blocking incoming calls from the employer.

item.title: Work From Home
item.description: Work From Home Concept Description The benefit or capability for employees to do their work from home or a remote location, away from an official company ofifce.

item.title: Work-Life Balance
item.description: Work-Life Balance Concept Description [[Placeholder]] Related To Sourced From [[Quiet Quitting]] [[Episode 3]] [[Episode 47]] [[Episode 68]]

item.title: Working In-Office
item.description: Working In-Office Concept Description A company cultural or organizational preference for employees to work from a company office instead of working from home or working remotely.

item.title: Writing is Thinking
item.description: Writing is Thinking Concept Description The process of organizing and writing out thoughts is the process of thinking. Without the organization and recording, thoughts are fleeting and lack structure.

item.title: Zettelkasten
item.description: Zettelkasten Concept Description “Slip box” linked note taking and thinking assistant. “Smart Notes” is an English generic description of Zettelkasten derived notes stored in a graph structure, where the links are just as important as the notes.
